Key Match Events: The Guardians lost to the Yankees 5-2 in 10 innings in Game 5 of the ALCS.
Hunter Gaddis allowed Juan Soto’s three-run homer in the 10th inning.
David Fry hit a walk-off homer in the 10th to win Game 3.
Post-Match Reflections: Guardians All-Star left fielder Steven Kwan expressed that the loss stings more because the games were so close.
Manager Stephen Vogt told his players to remember the feeling of the loss and use it to fuel their offseason.
Vogt highlighted the pride in the team's overall accomplishments despite the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cleveland left 47 runners on base, finishing 9 of 47 (.191) with runners in scoring position.
The Guardians' bullpen, which was strong from April to September, struggled in October.
The Yankees ended Cleveland’s season in the playoffs for the second time in three years.
